name: Butalbital
summary: A short- to intermediate-acting barbiturate used primarily in combination with other agents for tension or migraine headaches.
description: Butalbital is a barbiturate with sedative and muscle-relaxant properties. It is most often prescribed in fixed-dose combination products with acetaminophen, aspirin, and/or caffeine for the relief of tension headaches and sometimes migraine headaches. Its CNS depressant effects help alleviate muscle contraction-associated pain, but the drug carries risks of dependence, sedation, and rebound headaches with long-term use.

items: Tension headaches (combination with acetaminophen or aspirin and caffeine)

sections.text: Enhances the effects of GABA at the GABA-A receptor, leading to increased neuronal inhibition and CNS depression.

adult.tension-headache: Typically 50 mg butalbital with other agents every 4 hours as needed; maximum dependent on combination formulation

sections.geriatric: Use lowest effective dose; avoid chronic use
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; may require dose adjustment

items: Available only in combination tablets or capsules with acetaminophen, aspirin, caffeine, and/or codeine

other: High risk of dependence and overuse headaches

items.action: Avoid or use with extreme caution

sections.pregnancy: Category D; risk of fetal harm and neonatal withdrawal
sections.geriatrics: Increased risk of falls and sedation

sections.text: Taper gradually if used for prolonged periods to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

items: Not recommended for chronic headache disorders due to rebound risk
